dialogues.text: The dragon's head sways back and forth, then belches out waterfall of flame. It engulfs Jacopus and sends him to a better world, if there is one.

dialogues.speaker: HILL ROAD
dialogues.text: Horse and rider race across a night landscape under brood clouds. Up ahead, the sky glows with an angry red light. the crest of a hill Galen reins in and looks down across long valley. There, miles away, is the village of Swansco Many buildings are ablaze. As he watches in horror, fires spring up in the fields and trees. Intermittently he can the silhouette of the dragon as it spreads destruction.  Finally the creature swoops up and away. Galen stares sky losing sight of it in the clouds. For a moment, silence.  Then, with a thunderous rush of air that almost blows him from the saddle, the dragon reappears and hurtles a few f over his head! It is gone in an instant.

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGE
dialogues.text: Half the buildings in the town are on fire. Desperate  villagers dash here and there, herding children and anima to safety, trying to save their household goods. Galen wa woodenly into the confusion, leading his horse, taking in the scope of the disaster. He comes upon a line of men wh have formed a bucket brigade. He attempts to join up. As  soon as he is recognized, he is shouldered roughly aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away, you little bastard. We've  had enough help from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen staggers back, reaching for his horse. The animal s and trots off. A middle-aged woman appears in front of hi her face contorted with rage. She swings a flaming broom catches him on the back of the head. Galen reels away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen looks up and sees a couple of burlies moving his wa with boards in their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him! He's back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before they can get too close, Galen runs down an alley a bumps smack into a glassy-eyed, haunted man. It is Greil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greil -- help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May the Lord forgive you for what  you have done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes past. Galen ducks behind a smoldering building.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: The roof has burned off, but at least the walls are stand Valerian is wrestling charred timbers out of the center o the room. She is covered with soot. There is a hammering the door and Galen barges in. He slams the door behind hi and puts his back against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. Are you hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been? Doesn't matter --  listen: Quick! Make it rain. That'll  put the fire out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get the animals back. They're  all running loose. There's people  been hurt. Stop their pain. You can  cure them. And we'll need food...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this stops her) What? Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen's hand moves up to where the amulet used to hang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're a sorcerer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no sorcerer. Whatever power I  might have had, it's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know: I'm an imposter. A fraud. A  fake. I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, Valerian is too stunned to speak. Then her  face colors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sorry?! Listen to that! The  damn thing is loose, we're all on  fire and you're sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen sinks to the floor and sits in the ashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have the faintest idea  what you were doing, did you? You're  a fool -- and I'm a bigger one for  bringing you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snatches up a pitchfork and glowers at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you in this house. Get  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Galen still sits there like a puppet with its strings cut, every dream of glory utterly crushed. This piteous s touches Valerian's heart. Her gaze softens. She slowly lo the pitchfork.

dialogues.speaker: TOWN SQUARE
dialogues.text: A knot of villagers lead Tyrian and his henchmen across t square directly to the blacksmith's shop. The King's men  dismount and pound on the door. It swings open. Valerian standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here. I can't help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cry goes up from the villagers. They know damn well he' in there.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Tyrian pushes Valerian aside and steps into the room. Aid by some townfolk, his men proceed to ransack the premises overturning barrels, sticking their swords through flour  sacks, poking through the tumbledown thatch. Valerian's e falls on Malkin, who has involved himself in the search.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (returning her look) Damn right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finding nothing, the group pushes into the metal shop, wh Simon is hammering an iron wheel rim back into shape on a enormous anvil. He lays down his tools and grimly watches the men go through, overturning benches and tables. Tyria props a leg up on the anvil and addresses himself to Simo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the proud new father of an eligible  daughter who was some-how overlooked  all these years, it may interest you  to know that the King has called for  a new lottery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's months til the solstice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In view of what's happened, we all  know what's required.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never taken part in your cursed  lottery, and I'll have nothing to do  with it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were very clever. But she'll  take part, like all the rest. No  exceptions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The search party has exhausted the room's hiding places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. If he was here, he's gone  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrian nods and leads the way out. Simon catches up and p Tyrian aside at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. I know what you want. How  much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you offering me a bribe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't waste your time. (pause) You could never afford it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spins on his heel and joins his men as they ride out o town. Valerian and Simon watch them go. When the riders a out of sight, they return to the shop. With a couple of s poles, they strain to lift the anvil off its base. Finall it topples over. Valerian slides the base aside, revealin trap door. She raises it and a cramped Galen unfolds hims from the space below. On his face is a curious look of  determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith -- have you ever forged a  weapon?

dialogues.speaker: WEAPONS
dialogues.text: Simon is going through a cabinet, tossing out hoes, rakes sickles, scythes, plow blades, and a knife or two. Galen  examines them doubtfully. Now Simon produces an armload o swords. Galen is impressed; he looks them over carefully, testing and rejecting them in turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are your sharpest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon plucks up one of the swords, carries it to the cent of the room. He lays a horseshoe on the anvil. He brings sword down -- whack! -- and cuts the horseshoe in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Tyrian carries one of these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen hefts it dubiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sharp -- but it's not sharp  enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valerian has been watching all this with growing concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sharp enough for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what I'm going to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's that sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon gnaws his lip. Reluctantly, he brings a long box fr the bottom of the cabinet. He opens it. Lying on a bed of silk is an exquisite two-handed broadsword. The flat blad gleams like a mirror. Galen reaches in and lifts it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The best I ever made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valerian is as awed as Galen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen brings up a finger to test the edge. Simon grabs hi hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that! (he looks at Valerian) Girl-child, when you were born I  knew I had to do something, so I set  about the task of fashioning an  extraordinary weapon: I had the skill  to make it -- (bleak pause) -- but not the nerve to use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him with affection. Leaning forward, she pla a kiss on his bald pate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thankful for that. (to Galen) No man should choose a senseless  death.

dialogues.speaker: STREAM
dialogues.text: Galen, Valerian and Simon tramp through a glade to a moss bank. There a wide stream flows lazily under a canopy of  trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's me you're worried about,  don't. So my name has been entered,  what of it? There are hundreds of  girls. My name just won't be drawn.  I know it won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen walks out into the shallows and pushes the sword-ti into the sandy bottom, angled so that the edge splits the current.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valerian, this isn't just for your  sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks back to shore. All three watch the sword to see  what will happen.

dialogues.speaker: SWORD
dialogues.text: Big flat oak leaves are gliding along the current. Very  slowly, they go by the sword, some of them very close.  Finally, one of them floats against the leading edge of t blade and without a ripple is cleft in two. Simon gives G a significant look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. It doesn't matter.  What you want to kill isn't flesh  and blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it'll bleed, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know? No one's so much as  even scratched it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look to Galen. The apprentice's face is full of doub

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need the amulet.

dialogues.speaker: KING'S CASTLE
dialogues.text: Carrying torches to light their way, families -- some wit maiden daughters -- gather from all over the country in t courtyard of the King's castle. Simon is there with Valer and so is Galen, disguised in rough farm clothes and a wi brimmed hat. Like many others, he carries a stick topped  with a bleached skull -- to all appearances, just another participant in this weird pagan ritual. A barrel decorate with flames and dragon's wings sits on a raised dais in f of the main entrance. Horsrik, the King's herald, supervi preparations for the lottery. Armed guards appear carryin sealed chest. Horsrik breaks the seal and the guards pour the contents -- hundreds of wooden tiles, each bearing th name of a potential sacrifice -- into the barrel. Trumpet blare and drums roll and the royal party strolls onstage: the King, his daughter, courtiers and Tyrian. Valerian nu Galen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Look at her. The Princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. We've met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valerian gives Galen a sharp look. Horsrik unrolls a  parchment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading) People of Urland: whereas the peace  of the kingdom has been disrupted by  the mischief of an interloper; and  whereas this interloper being fled;  now therefore, his majesty the King  hereby proclaims the sum of thirty  ducats to be paid to anyone producing  the miscreant Galen Bradwardyn, fraud  enchanter, to our satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen pulls his hat low over his eyes. As the moment for drawing approaches, Valerian becomes more and more uneasy She pushes forward through the crowd until she's just bel the barrel. She eyes the people around her. Some of them  seem equally worried, others -- the better dressed and be fed -- are smug and complacent. The King and his retinue serene. A chant goes up from the crowd:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stir the tiles! Stir the tiles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horsrik picks up a wooden staff surmounted by a carved  dragon's head and stirs up the names. This done, a new ch goes up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bare the arm! Bare the arm!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a signal, a guard comes forward and cuts the sleeve fr Horsrik's right arm. He holds it high. The crowd surges  forward. The atmosphere is full of dread and excitement.  Valerian looking pale and determined, is jostled and push to the edge of the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draw the name! Draw the name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment has come. Down goes Horsrik's arm and up it co holding one little wooden square, one young woman's fate. expectant hush falls over the mob. The virgins of Urland  tremble and wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, my countrymen, hear me: behold,  for I am chosen. I shall die that  many may live. I shall lay down my  life for family and fellows. I shall  go to my grave for the love of our  King and his wise policy. And my  name is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at the tile to read the name, but no sound  comes to his lips. He looks back at the crowd, a cold swe breaking over his face. He swallows, but still can't brin himself to speak. At his feet, Valerian is holding her br A new chant goes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name! The name!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now Horsrik is trembling. He stares down at the tile, mouth set in a grim line. The King is getting annoyed. He gestures and the crowd falls silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mastering himself) The name is: Princess Elspeth Ulfilas,  filia regis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a moment of profound shock. Then a low murmur of wonder moves through the crowd. Galen looks at Valerian; sags with relief. The King turns to his daughter. She sho nothing. He rises from his chair, comes forward and snatc the tile from Horsrik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the name. It's been  misread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valerian will not stand for such hypocrisy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no mistake! The name's been  chosen -- let it stand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the good Horsrik has misspoke  himself. (he looks at the tile) In fairness to this individual, whose  name I can't make out, we'll destroy  this tile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly tosses the wood chip into a brazier at his elb Led by Valerian, the crowd cries out in protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! What better name than your own  kin? At last we see justice done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence! We will have a new choosing.  I will draw the name myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into the barrel and extracts another tile. He  looks at it and his eyes widen. Betrayed, he swivels to f his daughter. The din of the crowd reaches a crescendo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it stand! Let it stand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elspeth takes the tile from her father's nerveless finger looks at it with satisfaction and holds it aloft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name is as you heard it and as  Horsrik read it: Elspeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King moils through the tiles, finding his daughter's  name again and again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lottery is invalid. Another and  another. What treachery is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valerian, chanting with the rest, falls silent. She looks Elspeth with sudden interest and respect, then awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear me, good people! It is true,  that my name appears on many of the  lots. This does not falsify the  drawing, it certifies it! I have  learned that my name has been kept  from jeopardy in all the drawings in  the past. So I have put my name among  the rest many times -- once for each  risk that, over the years, you took  and I did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is dumbfounded. Gradually voices erupt in a  cacophony of shouts, whistles and excited conversation. G sees his chance: there's an unguarded door near the stabl He drifts toward it and slips inside.

dialogues.speaker: THRONE ROOM
dialogues.text: Galen pokes his head in: the room is empty. He scurries o to a chest, flings it open and starts rummaging. Finding  nothing he moves on to a cabinet. He breaks the lock and  pries it open. Again, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CASTLE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Galen can hear the voices in the courtyard as he rushes d a hall. Suddenly he stops short. There in front of him is guard leaning out a window to watch the proceedings. Gale hovers on the verge of panic as the guard abruptly moves. But the man is only headed for another window and a bette view. Galen manages to fall into step an arm's length beh him and slip by without a sound.

dialogues.speaker: LIBRARY
dialogues.text: Galen enters the library, his enormous shadow dancing cra on the torchlit walls. Hurrying through, his attention is drawn to some open books on a table. Closer inspection re magical writings and symbols. Galen paws over everything, suddenly aware that he must be close to the amulet. But w is it?

dialogues.speaker: COURTYARD
dialogues.text: As the crowd disperses Valerian watches Elspeth walk back the castle, lofty and composed. She looks for Galen and  discovers he has gone.

dialogues.speaker: LIBRARY
dialogues.text: By now, the room is in total disarray. Galen has opened a the chests and trunks and knocked half the books from the shelves. No amulet. He's feverishly working on a locked d when a voice interrupts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go to all that trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen whirls around to find the King standing in the door The monarch looks shattered. Galen edges toward the split the wall and finds that it has been shored up with timber At that moment Tyrian comes through the door, sizes up th situation and draws his sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm unarmed. If you want a fight, at  least give me a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing by the King) I think not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Don't harm him. (to Galen) And you -- don't run away... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King's voice is cracking. Galen and Tyrian are equall taken aback. The King searches through the books remainin on the library shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaky) I've always had the greatest  admiration for the black arts. You  chaps with your mysterious spells...  I didn't think it would be necessary,  you see. Vermithrax is an old dragon.  And that, I thought, was the beauty  of my plan -- buying time. We'd wait  her out. I'd live to see the end of  her. (firm) That's still going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The King finds the book and takes the amulet out. With  trembling hands, he passes it to Galen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shall have it. (pleading) It's my daughter. Save her, I beg  you.

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGE
dialogues.text: The people of Swanscombe are clearing up the rubble and  beginning repairs on their dwellings. Standing in their m lecturing every passerby, is Greil. He holds up the charr remains of Brother Jacopus' wooden cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy of holies -- he did not die in  vain. Can you hear me, brothers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some workmen go by lugging new thatch. Malkin is with the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) We hear you, Greil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well and good, but I'm Greil no  longer. Call me Gregorius, after the  Bishop of Rome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malkin and the others stop to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him die. Like Our Lord Jesus  on the cross he was, scourged by  evil. But he showed no fear. Such is  the power of the Holy Ghost.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKSMITH SHOP
dialogues.text: Galen lurks in the shadows of Simon's metal shop looking on the square where Greil is holding forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what avail is magic? The old gods  died with our daughters. From whence  comest my help? My help comest from  the Lord!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen quietly shuts and bars the door. He moves deeper in the gloomy workroom where Simon is pumping a bellows to h up the forge. Galen looks at the coals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good and hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother. That's not the kind of  fire we need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valerian is staring at the sword, sitting on the anvil in its silk wrapping. Galen uncovers it, holds it high, and  puts his hand on the amulet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nunc, per Potestatem Hermeticum --  ex flammis, ferrum sangrinarium!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sword starts to hum and to heat up. From the hilt out the blade glows brighter and brighter: red, orange, white It lights up the room, throwing long shadows into the cor Galen lays the white hot steel on the anvil. Simon takes his hammer and begins the reforging. Valerian sees their  resolve. After watching for several moments she slips out the side door, looking sad.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON COUNTRY
dialogues.text: Clouds scud low over the lifeless region. The dragon's la now has a newer, bigger entrance. Vapors drift upward fro it. Down the slope a lonely figure works its way from roc to rock: it's Valerian with a wicker basket on her arm,  searching for dragon scales. The basket is already more t half full when she finds herself ominously near the mouth the cavern. She's about to turn back when she spies a  particularly large and beautiful scale just a few yards  further on. As she reaches for it, there is a sudden hiss She jerks her hand back and freezes. There in the shadows a baby dragon, a basilisk, all coppery bronze with stubby winglets. As she backs away, she sees two more come up to join the first. They watch her retreat through wicked lit green eyes.

dialogues.speaker: STREAM
dialogues.text: On the mossy bank Galen and Simon unwrap the reforged swo Now the blade carries a faint blue halation. Galen walks the middle of the current and once again stabs the tip do into the sand. Then he rejoins Simon onshore to await res This time, as the oak leaves approach the sharp edge, the gently but definitely veer sideways to avoid contact. Suc is the power of the sword that even after many leaves, no single one has come close enough to be sliced. Simon is a and even Galen seems satisfied. They clasp hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An edge like no other on this earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done, Simon. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon hands him a bundle of fighting equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grave) I'll say goodbye to Valerian for  you. I'm sorry she's not here, but  you know how she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other for what could be the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fare thee well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old man departs. Galen unfolds the bundle and brings its contents: mail hauberk with coif, studded leather glo padded jerkin, a scabbard and a small wooden shield. He l them out on the stream bank, then strips off his tunic an kneels down to splash some water in his face. As the cups the water between his hands, an image comes alive and shi on the surface: Valerian, stripping off her own clothes,  shyly turning toward him, solemn and romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as if the vision is speaking to him, but it's not. H spins around and sees her standing there, fully clothed, possessed of a brisk and businesslike air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws down a shield. It's remarkable in its construc overlapping layers of iridescent dragon scales have been  ingeniously fastened to a leather-clad frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a shield. I made it. Might keep  the fire off you. Might not. You  know, you're an idiot. You're going  to die tonight. You'll be ripped  limb from limb. This is the last  time I'll ever speak to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen turns the shield over and over, marveling at it. He fixes her with a piercing look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rushing) Another thing. That thing isn't alone  up there. There's little ones. Young,  I think. I don't know how many.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shudders. Galen's eyes are still fastened on her. She fighting to retain her hard manner, but the agitation and dread are plain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hatchlings. They'll have to be killed  too. Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valerian wants to be bold, but on this final point, can't muster the courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tiny voice) You're in love, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly nodding) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right. I understand. She's  very beautiful, very brave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is? What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Princess. But I don't care. It  doesn't change the way I feel. (firm) Listen to me, Galen Bradwardyn,  sorcerer's apprentice; you're going  to be dead, the dragon will be worse  than ever, there will be more  lotteries, and I'm not a boy any  more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll be eligible because --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm still a virgin, and I  want you to do something about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen takes her in his arms; she is trembling. He tilts h face up toward his and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am in love. But not with the  Princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their image is reflected in the waters. Through the rippl she is visible pulling briefly away to remove her clothes From afar, they are two tiny figures under the overarchin oaks and willows. They embrace and sink down into the dee grass beside the water. The leaves continue their unhurri course downstream.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON COUNTRY
dialogues.text: A cold wind whistles through the rocks near the dragon's  lair. By the light of a flickering torch two workmen fini driving a heavy post into the ground. As they affix a pai of iron manacles they see the torches of a procession com up the slope. They hurry down to meet it. Horsrik is in t lead, followed by soldiers and royal attendants. Elspeth  rides in the tumbril behind a blindfolded horse. Bringing the rear is Tyrian. At last the cart can go no further.  Elspeth alights and leads the rest of the troop to the po As the soldiers put the irons around her wrists, Horsrik  unrolls a parchment, turns his back on the wind and begin to read:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now be it known throughout the  kingdom, that the Princess, having  been chosen by a deed of fortune and  destiny --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horsrik blinks. There's a black stain growing in the midd of the parchment; all at once it bursts into flames. He c out and flings the document away. There follows a flash o light and a puff of smoke and Galen is standing there, as he had materialized out of thin air. Horsrik and his star men backpedal down the slope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fire, I beg you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen raises his hands in a menacing gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough for Horsrik and company: he and the soldier depart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) I declare these proceedings duly  ordained...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one man remains behind the challenge the young sorce Tyrian. He draws his sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I'd find you here. Well, I'm  not as sentimental as some. The  kingdom, every one of us, need this  sacrifice. If you intend to interfere,  you'll have to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got plenty of reasons to kill  you that have nothing to do with  this sacrifice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen draws his own sword. As it emerges into the night a it seems imbued with a blue phosphorescence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most impressive. Can you use it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elspeth twists around in her chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it be! Please! Tyrian is right --  it's our only hope!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen starts to reply, but as soon as his attention waver Tyrian is lunging toward him, sword point directed at his neck. Galen barely manages to parry the thrust before Tyr is at him again, blade swinging toward his knees. Galen d the tip of his sword to catch the blow. When the two stee edges connect, sparks fly. In a series of thrusts and cou thrusts, each accompanied by a shower of sparks, Tyrian b Galen up the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrian -- both of you -- run! Flee!  It's coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough, at that moment the earth gives out a low moa and undulates in a sickening movement. Vapors begin risin from the lair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a trice! This is no swords-man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might be right, for Galen turns and bolts across the s When he reaches the post with Tyrian two steps behind, he whirls and brings his blade down on Princess Elspeth's ch The chains part in an explosion of sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run! Get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Princess darts from the piling as Tyrian swoops down continue the attack. Galen dodges and the stake catches  Tyrian's blow. The earth shakes again. Galen glances at t Princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Stop! What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elspeth is not running away down the mountain. Instead sh is walking, slowly and deliberately, right into the smoki cave. Swoosh! Tyrian's sword comes down again. The dismay sorcerer ducks back and Tyrian's blade again bites deep i the wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've failed, my friend, and I thank  the gods for it. Come out from behind  that post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's now or never. Elspeth is no longer in sight. Galen g his teeth, grasps the sword with two hands and swings it hard as he can in a wide arc. The blade never even slows  down as it sails right through the post, lopping it clean off. The glowing sword flashes above Galen's head and eag buries itself in Tyrian's chest. The King's man is as sta by the amputated piling as he is by his own death. His ey roll up in his head, his knees buckle and he topples back the blade sliding free.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON'S LAIR
dialogues.text: Smoke swirls at the mouth of the cave as Galen enters, ho his sword before him, lighting his way with its faint blu glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elspeth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor of the cave as it winds down into the mountain paved first with rock, then with dragon scales, then with bones. With each footfall, clusters of mysterious insects scuttle away. Galen pauses to mop his brow; it's getting  hot. A sound echoes up from the depths, a grinding sound  like the gnashing of teeth, followed by hissing and squea Galen grips his sword tighter and pushes on. Suddenly he  stoops and picks up an embroidered slipper: Elspeth's. Th grinding sounds are louder. He hurries forward and rounds corner. He stops and gags.

dialogues.speaker: BASILISKS
dialogues.text: Two disgusting little reptiles -- like scaly raccoons -- perched on the corpse of Princess Elspeth Ulfilas, feedin contentiously on choice bits of the royal flesh. Galen gr he lashes out and his sword beheads one of the tiny monst The other one buzzes its half-formed winglets and hisses hot stream of air. Galen brings down the sword and slices in half. Eyes riveted on Elspeth's remains, he edges arou the carnage and backs away. Hissss! -- there's a third on lurking in the shadows, munching on something; it might b hand. Galen shrieks and jumps away. The little creature c at him and clamps its jaws on his leg. Galen stabs at it  repeatedly. Finally it lets go, and flails and flops acro the bloody floor, ululating its death agony. As the creat last mewlings echo down through the cavern, the ground  quivers. Bits of stone fall from the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: LAKE OF FIRE
dialogues.text: Galen works his way down a narrow passage whose walls are alive with insects and beads of sulphurous water. As befo he holds the sword in front of him; he marvels at its  increasing brightness. The heat is increasing too; sweat  mats his hair and runs down his face. A few yards further the sword starts pulsating. Now the walls take on a flick rosy sheen and the passage widens into an underground vis of staggering immensity: an underground lake, its surface bubbling and torn with sheets of flame. Arching over it i vault of stone, penetrated here and there by natural chim The dimensions of this internal world are unknown -- the  fiery lake disappears into half a dozen side chambers. Th one clear path is accessible only by a series of flat sto leading across the hot liquid. Galen grips his sword and  resolutely hops from rock to rock.

dialogues.speaker: VERMITHRAX
dialogues.text: He's halfway across when the earth rumbles and the steppi stones teeter beneath his feet. A fiery wave washes over legs, leaving his boots smoking. Another tremor knocks Ga to his knees. As he scrabbles to pick up his sword and sh the great head of Vermithrax rises up out of the depths o its long neck. It gazes at him through huge pale eyes und armored lids. A tongue flicks out and runs around its lip mouth. The head sways from side to side. The mouth hinges open, the nostril-like igniters come on and touch off the jet of gas squeezed up out of its innards. A roaring tube flame engulfs Galen. He crouches behind his dragon scale  shield which deflects the fire just enough to save his li The dragon pauses to take a breath. Galen springs to his  feet, and bounds back the way he came, his skin and cloth singed. Flames lick at his back as the dragon lets fly wi a second burst.

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Coughing and weeping, Galen staggers up through the tunne nearly tripping over the body of one of the baby dragons. few seconds later, Vermithrax follows, squirming and claw its way upward. When it reaches its dead offspring it sur the scene with expressionless eyes. Bringing its head low it sniffs and nudges at the lifeless little ones.

dialogues.speaker: AMBUSH
dialogues.text: At that moment Galen leaps out from behind a niche in the tunnel wall and lunges forward. Striking sparks, the poin of his sword slides across the dragon's plated cheek and  stabs deep between the scales of its heavy neck. There is unearthly shriek and the creature flicks its head back an upward. Galen goes sprawling and finds himself holding ha a sword. The rest is buried in the beast's neck, and  Vermithrax doesn't like it. It flings its head this way a that, knocking rocks loose from the ceiling. Its movement cause the ground to quake. As boulders tumble around him, Galen drops to the floor under his shield. Dragon flame  reaches through the cascading debris and washes over him.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Valerian roams the rock-strewn slope not far from the dra lair. Presently she comes upon a once-familiar object -- fire shield. Half the scales are gone, the rest are charr and curling. Grimly, she moves on. A few paces away she p up the blunted sword. She scans the rocks and finally see what she's looking for.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: He's lying face down behind a boulder, his clothes charre patches of skin scorched. He looks dead. Valerian rolls h onto his back. She gasps: the eyes are open, regarding he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still alive.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKSMITH SHOP
dialogues.text: Simon is standing by the anvil with the broken sword in h hand, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSE
dialogues.text: In the adjoining house Valerian tends Galen's wounds. He' propped up on a palette enduring the application of poult

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what we have to do. (he looks at her with  dull eyes) We have to leave Urland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He winces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not because of what happened. I  brought you here -- it didn't work --  now I'm taking you away. Do you  understand? (Galen does not react) You said you loved me. Is it true?  If it is, it's the only good we've  done. Let's not lose that too. (pause) Galen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems miles away. She turns aside, on the verge of tea Simon is standing there, still holding the sword hilt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right. What kind of a life  could you have here? It's too late  for me, but you're young enough. (he shows them the  sword) You know what I think? Magic is dying  out, fading from the world. But that  makes me happy. That means the dragon  will be dying too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen looks at him; he has heard everything. He sits up a fondly regards Valerian.

dialogues.speaker: PACKING
dialogues.text: Valerian packs her belongings into a rucksack. The last i in is her blue frock, carefully rolled. Beside her, Galen dons clean traveling clothes. He stiffly crosses the room and drags his pack out of the corner. He sorts through th effects, and amidst the clothing and supplies discovers t leather pouch containing Ulrich's remains. He contemplate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I was just thinking -- poor  Hodge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tucks the pouch away, throws some clothes on top and t the satchel shut.

dialogues.speaker: STREAM
dialogues.text: Beside the quiet stream Simon bids farewell to the young  couple, embracing each in turn. They slosh across the sha water and follow a path into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGE SQUARE
dialogues.text: Greil is standing outside the half-burned grange hall,  summoning the Christian faithful. He proclaims the call t worship by hammering on a small bell. One by one the town arrive. Among them is Simon, looking bereft.

dialogues.speaker: FOREST PATH
dialogues.text: Valerian and Galen trudge along side by side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your leg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurts. That thing was small, but its  teeth were sharp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least you killed it. You got all  the young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is small consolation, and Galen sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the big one's alive. Somewhere  down in that burning lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think about it. You had your  fight, and you're still here. That's  more than anyone else can say. Let's  think about what lies ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches out to take his hand. But Galen is no longer her side. She stops and looks back.

dialogues.speaker: GALEN
dialogues.text: Galen has come to a halt in the middle of the path. He's  staring into the middle distance with a sudden inspiratio bubbling in his brain. He flings off his sack, drops to h knees and tears through the contents. Valerian comes back baffled. Galen's gear is strewn all over the trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen comes up with what he's looking for -- the leather  sack. When he replies, it is not to her, but to Ulrich:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You old trickster! The burning water!  The lake of fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen, what are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He regards her with astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had it planned. He knew this was  going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to go back, I want to talk  to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads back down the trail, leaving his belongings on t road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries after him.

dialogues.speaker: GRANGE HALL
dialogues.text: Greil, a.k.a. Gregorious, stands in the center of the bur out granary, delivering a sermon. Behind him, men are fil the baptismal cistern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Church is mother to us all. Not  just one lonely orphan who has lost  his way, not just a few, but all of  us that believeth in Him. When enough  voices come together in prayer, He  shall hear, we shall live and the  beast shall die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the gathering Simon ponders the hilt of his once fabul sword. With its blade shortened, it looks a lot like a  crucifix.

dialogues.speaker: DRAGON COUNTRY
dialogues.text: Galen bounds up the rocky slope as fast as he can manage, trailed by a desperate Valerian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen, stop! Please, I beg you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Galen pays no attention. In a burst of speed and fury Valerian comes up behind and tackles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! I won't let you kill yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen waves the leather pouch in Valerian's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He couldn't walk -- he knew he  couldn't make the journey. So he had  us make the journey for him! Don't  you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumps up and runs to the mouth of the lair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pursuing) No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tackles him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right. You're going  in there, I'm going too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brought up short) What? Why? No you're not, this is my  job. Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Valerian springs to her feet and starts into the lair

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid. And you're not going  to stop me. After all -- I've been a  man longer than you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen pauses long enough to snatch up a discarded torch n the remains of the wooden stake, then charges after her.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERGROUND
dialogues.text: Running footsteps resound in the steamy passageway and Ga comes around the corner holding his torch high to light t way. Valerian stumbles after him. He grabs her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down and down they go. Soon they reach Elspeth's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she pulls the torch from his hand and goes over to se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He darts off. In the flickering torchlight Valerian can s the Princess' remains all too clearly. She suppresses a  scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen? Galen? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. The torch reveals several passages. She doesn' know which one to take.

dialogues.speaker: LAKE OF FIRE
dialogues.text: The passage widens out and once again Galen is standing o the shores of the lake of fire. He looks around. The wate is rolling with bubbles of gas, and flames run hither and yon across the surface, but there is no sign of the drago Gathering his courage, he hops across the stepping stones the middle of the lake. There he hurriedly opens the pouc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ex favilla, vita nova!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gripping the amulet with his free hand, he scatters Ulric ashes in a wide arc over the burning water. Instantly, th is an ominous rumble and the earth gives a shrug. But no  wizard appears. No dragon, either. There follows another stronger quake. Galen crouches to keep his balance. Still wizard.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Thoroughly bewildered, Valerian stumbles out into dayligh She wanders a few yards down the slope and collapses agai the stake. Something is strange: it's getting dark. Squin up at the sun, she frowns in puzzlement, then gapes at wh is happening.

dialogues.speaker: ECLIPSE
dialogues.text: Slowly and ponderously the black disk of the moon slides  over the face of the sun, plunging the world into crepusc half-light.

dialogues.speaker: GRANGE HALL
dialogues.text: The congregation is confused and frightened by the sudden darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be calm. He watcheth over us! And  this is His sign! Let us pray! Our  Father who art in heaven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faithful bow their heads and join in. Simon as well.

dialogues.speaker: LAKE OF FIRE
dialogues.text: The earthquakes have subsided; the water is calm. Galen s bleakly into the flames. As he watches, they gather thems into a lazy spiral. Gradually the spiral speeds up and be a vortex. Now the flames become tinged with green, and as the cavern moans with the sound of rushing air, a form ta shape at the crest of a jet of flame. It is Ulrich, supin as upon his pyre, reforming before Galen's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ulrich! Magister! Over here! I can  see you! Over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at him) Not so loud. I'm not deaf, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slowly raises himself into an upright posture and stri through the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sic redit magus ex terra mortis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apprentice throws himself at his master's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonder of wonders -- you're back! I  thank the powers that made me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glad to see you, too. You didn't  bring along anything to eat, by any  chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Oh well, no time anyway.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Valerian is standing in the unearthly twilight, anxiously peering into the mouth of the lair. Suddenly she is hit f behind by a gust of wind. She does not turn to see the  enormous Vermithrax alighting silently behind her. GALEN & ULRICH Ulrich raises Galen to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come along. There's much to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I have something to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it can't. Listen: I thought I was  a sorcerer -- but I wasn't. I thought  I had power -- but I didn't. I thought  I was you -- but I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs his head. Ulrich regards him steadily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well said. Now hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads the way across the rocks to the shore and into t tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: VALERIAN
dialogues.text: Time seems to have come to a stop. Overhead, the moon is  locked in front of the sun. At the lair, Valerian stands  frozen as the dragon leans over her. The great head sways from side to side. The jaws hinge open. Suddenly, Valeria recovers herself and makes a run for it, leaping and  scrabbling over the rocks. A plume of flame licks at her  heels. She sees a protective crevice and heads for it, bu winged claw drops to block her way. She changes direction and is cut off again. Cat and mouse.

dialogues.speaker: VERMITHRAX
dialogues.text: The pale yellow eyes stare implacably down at the hopeles victim. The igniter jets come on, then off, as the beast  suddenly stiffens. The head rotates, almost as if catchin new scent. Finally the eyes focus on the entrance to the  cavern.

dialogues.speaker: ULRICH
dialogues.text: There is the sorcerer, leaning on Galen, coolly regarding the creature. The old man's expression hardens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draco draconis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dragon lifts its wings as if to menace them, then fla twice and is airborne. The thing shoots overhead and, wit rush of wind, flies off into the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ROCKS
dialogues.text: Valerian struggles out of her hiding place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen runs to her. They embrace. When they look up, Ulric is at their side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my amulet? Give it to me,  please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen's hand locates the jewel under his shirt. He finds  himself reluctant to part with it. With a hurricane howl, a column of flame touches down nea and rushes toward them. They stagger back as the dragon s past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen hands his treasure over. Ulrich closes his hand aro it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come close to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen and Valerian approach. The old man's hand is suffus with an internal glow. Behind them, the dragon is turning for another pass.

dialogues.speaker: VORTEX
dialogues.text: All at once the glow brightens, and in another instant th world spins off into a blur, setting all three afloat in timeless netherworld. Valerian and Galen cling to each ot in terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid. You have served me  with great courage. Now you must  show me you have even more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voices seem to be coming from a huge distance. Starli gleams whiz by, and fleeting glimpses of half-recognizabl faces and forms. The wizard's eyes are like glittering  crystals. Tiny motes and planetoids dance in the hairs of his beard. He seems wreathed in luminescence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must destroy the amulet, and me  along with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought me from the flames, you  must send me back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the time comes, you'll  understand. Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dangles the amulet in front of Galen. Even more reluct than he let it go, he takes it back.

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAIN TOP
dialogues.text: Abruptly, the vortex is gone and they find themselves ato rocky crag overlooking the eclipse-darkened fields and fa of Urland. Galen glances at his surroundings and stares a the amulet, full of awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking. You  have learned much and done well.  Don't worry, you won't need it any  more.

dialogues.speaker: GRANGE HALL
dialogues.text: Greil is urging Simon, the last of the converts, into the cistern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make haste, brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dips Simon's head under water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now be thou baptized in the name of  the Father, Son and Holy Ghost. May  the Lord our God light our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, half the congregation is staring throu the burned-out walls, fervently praying and crossing  themselves, wondering if they'll ever see the sun again. cry goes up: a shape crosses the solar corona, wheels ove the village and streaks away toward the mountains -- the  dragon.

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAIN TOP
dialogues.text: Galen and Valerian peer out from behind a boulder and wat Ulrich hobble perilously close to the edge of the cliff. old man spreads wide his arms and tilts his head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nimbus! Tempestas! Fulmen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From over the horizon roiling inky-black clouds churn dow upon them. Thunder booms and echoes. A bitter wind whips  their clothing. As the storm gathers fury, the dragon  reappears, circling in the distance. Finally it homes in the mountain crag and dives at Ulrich. The conjurer makes gesture and strokes of lightning explode against the beas scaly flanks. It emits a high thin scream and rockets pas GALEN & VALERIAN Valerian crawls away and comes back with a hefty chunk of granite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Do as he said. Smash it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if it means killing him.

dialogues.speaker: ULRICH
dialogues.text: He resolutely waits as the dragon banks against the cloud and starts another pass. Again, the sorcerer summons ligh bolts. But the dragon keeps coming; this time a talon spl the old man's cape. GALEN & VALERIAN Valerian wrestles the amulet away from Galen. It falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard what he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lifts the chunk of stone. Galen grabs for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You can't!

dialogues.speaker: THE LAST ATTACK
dialogues.text: Vermithrax spirals up into the storm, then drops earthwar Ulrich watches as the beast comes straight at him. He fol his arms and bows his head. Leathery wings humming, the  creature levels out, swoops up past the crag and lifts th master magician away in its huge hind claw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen and Valerian are horrified to see the dragon circli upward with the sorcerer writhing in agony in its grip. A the monstrous thing flies high over them, they can hear  Ulrich's faint screams.

dialogues.speaker: DEATH
dialogues.text: Now Galen understands. He seizes the granite block from  Valerian and raises it with both hands over his head. He  takes a final look at the amulet, glowing at his feet, th brings the rock down with all his might. There is a blind flash as it shatters into a million fragments. Far above there is another blinding flash as Ulrich's ear body explodes against the belly of the beast. The darkene sky lights up as huge gouts of flame spew forth from the  dragon's gut. Wings fluttering uselessly, this reptilian  torch plummets to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LAKE
dialogues.text: Below, a stock pond nestled in the foothill pastures. Tra a wake of flame, Vermithrax plunges like a comet into the water. There is a stupendous splash and eruption of steam GALEN & VALERIAN They stare down from their lofty perch, watching as furth explosions boil the water from the pond.

dialogues.speaker: ECLIPSE
dialogues.text: Behind a tattered wrack of cloud, the moon slowly uncover pale sun.

dialogues.speaker: THE CARCASS
dialogues.text: Grey misty light reveals the beast's mangled remains. Gal and Valerian emerge from the fog, walk under a blackened  wing and make their way through the mud and loose scales the huge charred head. The death agony has twisted it ups down. The mouth is frozen in a grotesque look of surprise The eyes are glazed. Now the sound of voices floats towar them, chanting an ancient hymn. A moment later a mob of  Christians, led by Greil, crests a hill and moves toward hulk. The song ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us pray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The members of the congregation fall to their knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We thank thee, Lord, for this divine  deliverance. Verily is thy presence  amongst us, fully manifest in this,  thy great work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen and Valerian look at each other. She takes his hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arise, children of the Lord and  forsake evermore the pagan mysteries.  Rejoice in the true power of the  Christian God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen turns and leads Valerian away. They disappear into mist.

dialogues.speaker: FLENSING
dialogues.text: In the clear light of a new day, ladders have been tipped against the creature's back. Teams of men swarm over the  crusted flesh, slicing off long strips for piecemeal buri Below, yoked oxen drag the heavy carrion away on sledges. the background other workmen dump the remains into an ope pit.

dialogues.speaker: THE KING
dialogues.text: With the crack of a whip and the clatter of hooves, the r coach pulls up to the shore of the lake. A door creaks op and King Casiodorus totters out. His face is puffy, his e are red. He slogs through the mud to the head of the drag and commences hacking at it with a ceremonial sword. Hors steps out of the coach and draws himself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud) All hail Casiodorus Rex -- Dragon  slayer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The workers pause long enough to listen to this pronounce and cast a glance at the sorry spectacle. Wordlessly they resume their labors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) Hail and praise be!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROAD
dialogues.text: The trail leads through copses and open meadows. Side by  side, Galen and Valerian march up a long slope under a ho sun. He limps a bit; she finds a staff and hands it to hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to rest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You miss Ulricn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the amulet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me. I'm glad it's gone. I'm glad  you did what you did. (he doesn't reply) You may not be a sorcerer, Galen,  but I love you anyway. I don't regret  anything that happened. I just wish --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) -- that we had a horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen falls a step behind. He briefly closes his eyes and mutters something. They walk on a few paces. Then there i whinny from the nearby woods and a white stallion canters forth. It crosses a meadow, comes right up to Valerian an nuzzles her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you...!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It must have been wandering loose.  Or wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galen climbs aboard. He reaches out to help her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. I just wished for a  horse and here it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to wish it gone, do  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
